circumstances: Julie Kirk, a young girl living with her foster parents, left her home on Leachkin Road, Inverness, in the middle of the night, sparking concerns among her caretakers. Before her disappearance, whispers of her association with a local political fringe group caught the attention of her foster father. Her decision to wander away at such an hour brought memories of a previous incident where she was found at an obscure location, a cave near Longman Road, Inverness. As the search extended, her foster mother revisited the youth center, imagining the child might seek familiar grounds. Eventually, the police traced Julie to Culduthel Park, safe and unharmed, ending her brief but worrying absence.

circumstances: Julie Kirk, an 8-year-old girl, was last seen near her foster home on Leachkin Road, Inverness. On the day of her disappearance, she had visited the gym with her foster mother and Shirley Cox, a colleague of the foster mother, located on Sir Walter Scott Drive, Inverness. After a routine practice, Julie seemed content and was seen leaving the gym. Her foster mother believed Julie might have felt adventurous and took the wrong turn while walking back home. The vehicle-related factors came into play as a friend last saw Julie running through the parking lot situated on 25 Harbour Road, Inverness. With mounting concern for Julie’s wellbeing, a city-wide search was initiated. Eventually, a member of the public recognized her at 11 Eastgate, Inverness, bringing her safely back to her foster home.

circumstances: Julie Kirk, a vibrant 8-year-old with a penchant for adventures, was reported missing from a dance studio located at 11 Eastgate, Inverness. Her foster mother discovered she was not at the dance studio when she went to pick her up. Julie had developed an obsession with an online game group, which seemed to capture her attention more than her usual activities. It's believed that her fascination with the game may have led her to wander off to meet friends from this virtual world. Sightings of a girl resembling Julie were reported near a movie theater on Glenurquhart Road. Meanwhile, her friend mentioned seeing her talking about wanting to visit the tutoring center on Sir Walter Scott Drive. Police traced her steps and, fortunately, found her safe at 11 Eastgate, where she had returned after realizing the dangers of her actions.

circumstances: Julie Kirk was last seen at her home on Leachkin Road, Inverness. Her foster mother noticed a heightened interest in an online game, which seemed to captivate Julie's attention more than usual. On the day of her disappearance, she mentioned visiting a friend at Orchard Park in Beauly but never arrived. Her foster father attempted to reach her several times, without success. Concerned, they reached out to Julie's friend and the friend's foster mother, learning that no plans were made to meet at Orchard Park. After a citywide search, she was found safe by the police at Culduthel Park. Julie had become engrossed in an online group meetup, losing track of time.
